title: Free Market Capitalist
author: Free Market Capitalist
content: This method of earning allows you to earn $1000 a day or moreIt is a clear case of a scam attempt for which there is no need to give many explanations, but I was thinking if it would be worth creating a flag so that newbies and unregistered forum visitors could see it clearly. I think it's most likely that after my tag and the responses he got to his thread, he won't be very active here again, but I hesitate to create the flag just in case.

comments.author: ineedhelpplease
comments.body: Are there any consequences to creating flags? I think we should create oneI’ve seen this thread before and I replied to it he is just full of bogus especially for a new account. If he was genuine he would let some of the more ranked up members of the community receive a free vouch copy of this guide

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Worth or not depends on each user, but the answer is you can flag him and no one will blame you for doing that since it's clear he's a scammer.For me flagging a newbie without any reputation is too much work.Quote from: ineedhelpplease on December 14, 2023, 06:38:07 AMAre there any consequences to creating flags? I think we should create oneIf you wrongly flagging someone you might dragged into drama because flag can't be deleted, you can only oppose it.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: I would not lose sleep about that user; do what is best, and I will support it. Feel strange being on the same page with you for the first time.  Quote from: Poker Player on December 13, 2023, 04:29:14 AMIf you invest as little as $100, with a 40% daily return, reinvesting what you earn each day, at the end of just one month (30 days) you would have $2,420,143.24. You tell me what the fuck the OP is doing here promoting his "system" instead of being on his way to his private island with his yacht full of models and bottles of champagne.Sao Paulo girls you mean?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: It's a flaggable case though you would need to first create a scam accusation with reasons showing that person is likely a scammer. That can to be used as a reference and not necessarily the link from that thread as it can be moved to archival or deleted any time. Some newbies or guest users won't know about ninjastic.space archiving tool.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I would say yes, more warning means less people fall for such scam (even though it's one of obvious scam attempt). Don't forget show this forum show yellow or red warning (based on flag type) for people who visit this forum without login.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: But sometimes, it is better to report such a thread for it to be deleted. Posting something like 'scam' and nothing useful than that. That will make moderator to easily delete it.I have also given the scammer a negative trust. Obviously this is a scam.Quote from: ETFbitcoin on December 14, 2023, 09:13:23 AMI would say yes, more warning means less people fall for such scam (even though it's one of obvious scam attempt). Don't forget show this forum show yellow or red warning (based on flag type) for people who visit this forum without login.This is right, a flag will let people easily notice that it is a scam. But I am always wondering how some people can believe in such way to earn money. Earn $1000 daily or more? Obviously it is a scam.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Apocollapse on December 14, 2023, 07:02:55 AMFor me flagging a newbie without any reputation is too much work.Agreed, which is why I stopped tagging account sellers using brand new accounts long ago; it's just a waste of time.  And the flag system....I never really understood why the trust system, which was already convoluted, had to be further complicated by adding the flagging in.  I say do whatever you feel comfortable with, Poker Player.  Nobody's going to give you shit about whatever it is you decide, so nail that sucker to the wall with any tool you can find.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: OP, you can do whatever you think will make other people safe from that scammer, because he thinks he can come to this forum with his scamming project to scam people so if you flag him, he will know that this place is not such a place for him . Each time I see his thread on the service board, I keep wondering why the mods haven't deleted it. Even though the account has no reputation, he still  deserves to face the consequences of his actions.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on December 14, 2023, 09:58:33 AMThat will make moderator to easily delete it.Nop! They won't. Scam is not moderated here, you could probably start a new thread offering to scam people straight away and the mods won't delete it.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: mikeywith on December 14, 2023, 03:36:10 PMNop! They won't. comments.body: He already has two tags from you and C-T. IMO, it's enough to send the message across to anyone who sees his post and goes through those tags. Secondly, with those tags on him, it's not going to be very comfortable for him to shill those his scam get rich quick fucking schem.

Just pursue creating a flag for him so he will be aware that all our eyes are on him. Otherwise, if we let him keep doing that, he might think that the forum members are very easy to deceive, and we don't want that to happen.Obviously he won't be active here again because he is now caught on his modus operandi.
